item.title: All-New Kindles Hit Their Lowest Prices Of The Year For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/all-new-kindles-hit-their-lowest-prices-of-the-year-for-black-friday/1100-6527986/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Amazon recently launched an updated lineup of its popular Kindle ereaders, and for Black Friday many of these are now seeing generous price cuts. The brand-new Kindle Colorsoft is still full price, but now is a great time to pick up the revised Kindle Paperwhite or Kindle, as they’re both down to their lowest price ever. A trade-in offer is also available, which gets you 20% off select Kindles when trading in your old device.

The Kindle Paperwhite (16GB) is on sale for $130 (was $160), and it might be the most enticing offer of the bunch. With a seven-inch display, weeks of battery life, and improved hardware resulting in 25% faster page turns, it should provide for an incredibly smooth reading experience. An adjustable front light ensures your pages are always easy to see, so whether you're out in the sun or curled up in bed, your Kindle Paperwhite is a great companion.

You’ll also find the Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition on sale for $155 (was $200). Along with more storage (32GB compared to 16GB), it comes with an auto-adjusting front light and support for wireless charging. Beyond that, the two are largely the same.

Other great deals include the Kindle for $85 (was $110) and Kindle Kids for $95 (was $130). These don’t feature front lights that are as adjustable as the Paperwhite lineup, but they still get you weeks of battery life and a vibrant 300ppi display--though it's slightly smaller at six inches. The Kids version bundles in an Amazon Kids+ subscription, which gets you access to a large collection of children’s books, graphic novels, and more. Best of all, you’ll get a cover to protect the ereader and a two-year worry-free guarantee.

A few other Kindles are on sale for Black Friday, and you’ll find the best deals below. There’s also a solid price cut on the Fire Max 11 Tablet if you want something with more versatility. Plenty of other Amazon Devices are also discounted right now, so check out the full collection for more great offers.

Best Black Friday Kindle Deals

  • Kindle Paperwhite (16GB) -- $130 ($160)
  • Kindle Paperwhite Signature Edition (32GB) -- $155 ($200)
  • Kindle -- $85 ($110)
  • Kindle Kids -- $95 ($130)
  • Kindle Paperwhite Kids -- $140 ($180)
  • Amazon Fire Max 11 Tablet -- $140 ($230)

  • The PS5 Pro Is Available Now And Eligible For One-Day Delivery At Amazon

  • Target's Exclusive Shadow The Hedgehog Lego Set Is Discounted Just Weeks After Its Release

item.title: Armored Core 6 And The Official Hardcover Guidebook Are Cheap For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/armored-core-6-and-the-official-hardcover-guidebook-are-cheap-for-black-friday/1100-6527981/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

From Software fans can get Armored Core 6: Fires of Rubicon and the official hardcover guidebook for cheap as part of Amazon's Black Friday 2024 sale. You can snag the challenging mecha-based action game for only $20 for PS5, PS4, and Xbox--the Xbox edition is compatible with Series X and Xbox One. Meanwhile, the Armored Core 6 Pilot's Manual is on sale for $32.60, down from $45, which is one of its lowest prices since its publication last December.

Armored Core 6

$20 (was $60)

Today, From Software is known as the studio behind Dark Souls, Bloodborne, and Elden Ring--which is also on sale for cheap at Amazon for Black Friday--but in the '90s and early 2000s, the studio's claim to fame was Armored Core. And following a decade-long hiatus, the series returned in style last year with Armored Core 6. As a sci-fi series with mecha-based vehicular combat, Armored Core is substantially different thematically from the Souls games.

That said, Dark Souls veterans who have never played Armored Core will feel right at home in terms of the challenge. There's a deep strategic element to Armored Core, too, as part of the fun and challenge comes from outfitting the eponymous Armored Core (your mecha suit). Like other recent From Software games, Armored Core 6 has some incredible and thoroughly imposing bosses to topple.

Armored Core 6: Pilot's Manual

$32.60 (was $45)

Published by Future Press, Armored Core 6: Pilot's Manual is an extremely useful resource for new and returning Armored Core players. It's also simply a well-made and designed hardcover book with full-color illustrations and display-worthy cover art.

The 448-page book offers a comprehensive deep dive into the world of Armored Core 6, including a detailed look at all 100-plus mecha specs and how they impact your chances for success in combat. It also teaches you how to effectively modify your build with the many, many swappable components you have to work with.

All 59 missions are covered across 200 pages of the book. These are step-by-step walkthroughs, complete with maps and build recommendations based on the challenge at hand. To help you get through each mission, you can consult the enemy intel sections, which provide meticulous examinations of enemy behaviors as well as strengths/weaknesses.

For those who truly want to master Armored Core 6, there's a 50-page section designed to help you get S-Rank grades for each mission. This section also has other helpful checklists and charts, including details. on unlocking trophies/achievements.

Elden Ring Black Friday Deals

  • Elden Ring
    • PS5 -- $20 ($60)
    • Xbox Series X -- $20 ($60)
    • PS4 -- $20 ($60)
  • Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Edition
    • PS5 -- $50 ($80)
    • Xbox Series X -- $50 ($80)
    • Xbox Series X|S digital edition -- $40 ($80)

item.title: First MLB The Show 25 Details Revealed, Sets And Seasons To Be Retired
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/first-mlb-the-show-25-details-revealed-sets-and-seasons-to-be-retired/1100-6527961/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Following the recent conclusion of the 2024 Major League Baseball season, Sony's San Diego Studio has given fans their first look at what's in store for MLB The Show 25, confirming straight off the bat that the unpopular Sets and Seasons feature will not be returning.

Sets and Seasons appears to be retiring even before MLB 25 debuts, with the developer announcing that you'll be able to use any card you want in Season 4 of MLB The Show 24, including cards that are in your inventory from a previous season.

MLB The Show 24 - Official Legends Trailer

Want us to remember this setting for all your devices?

Sign up or Sign in now!

Please use a html5 video capable browser to watch videos.

This video has an invalid file format.

Sorry, but you can't access this content!

"We appreciate the feedback from our community and have also decided that Sets and Seasons will not be returning in MLB The Show 25, allowing every card to be used freely throughout the year," the announcement on the PlayStation Blog says, adding that the direction of MLB 24 Season 4 will give players an idea of how the developers will approach next year's game.

Players will even be able to begin earning rewards for MLB 25 as they play through Season 4 with the new Now & Later MLB The Show Packs, with each Now & Later pack able to be redeemed for a regular pack in MLB The Show 25.

The developer also teased a number of improvements coming in the next installment of the franchise, including deeper player journeys in Road to the Show, new elements of Diamond Dynasty that will replace Sets and Seasons, and improved Franchise trade metrics and offseason play. The gameplay is also set for a bit of a refresh, with MLB 25 expanding on quick-time events, defensive AI, and updated pathing for more engaging gameplay in the moment.

We can expect to hear more about MLB 25 and what it will be bringing to the franchise in the lead up to its release, which can be expected around the start of the Major League Baseball season in March next year.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: SpongeBob: A Patrick Star Game's Steelbook Edition Is On Sale For A Good Price Right Now
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/spongebob-a-patrick-star-games-steelbook-edition-is-on-sale-for-a-good-price-right-now/1100-6527980/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

SpongeBob SquarePants: A Patrick Star Game launched in October, and if you're looking to score a deal on the game based on the popular Nickelodeon TV series, you're in luck. For Black Friday, Best Buy is selling its Switch-exclusive Steelbook edition for only $35. It normally sells for $50.

The Steelbook itself is covered from top to bottom with Patrick's smiling face. If you're a big fan of Patrick Star, this might be the perfect item to go on your mantle to display proudly.

A Patrick Star Game is, as its name suggests, a game about Patrick Star. Set in Bikini Bottom, the game has players taking on physics-based challenges designed by SpongeBob, Sandy, and Mr. Krabs, all of whom also appear in the game.

The first solo adventure for Patrick, the game was developed by PHL Collective and published by Outright Games. While the Steelbook edition is exclusive to Switch, A Patrick Star Game is also available on PC, Xbox, and PlayStation.

If A Patrick Star Game isn't your thing, Best Buy's Black Friday sale has deals on many other games, including a solid discount on Life is Strange: Double Exposure. Beyond Best Buy, Amazon has a range of great deals for Black Friday as well--check out the hub below to see all the best offers.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: One Of The Year's Best Games Just Added Nine More Levels For Free
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/one-of-the-years-best-games-just-added-nine-more-levels-for-free/1100-6527982/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Strange Scaffold released its follow-up to El Paso Elsewhere , I Am Your Beast, back in September. It launched with a short-but-sweet campaign, but with the debut of a new free update today, it now has nine additional levels for players to check out.

The new additions are part of the Support Group pack that serves as an epilogue to the game's story. I Am Your Beast puts players in control of Alphonse Harding, an ex-secret agent who is sick and tired of being called back in to do one more job. When Harding finally turns down his former employers at the Cover Operations Initiative, the agency sends multiple operatives to kill him.

According to Strange Scaffold, the epilogue will feature traumatized Cover Operatives Imitative agents who act as the unreliable narrators for the expansion. That may explain why players suddenly have superhuman strength and abilities that include the power to literally punch someone's head off of their body.

Strange Scaffold also released a new trailer for I Am Your Beast that shares some of the glowing reviews and accolades the game has received so far.

I Am Your Beast is currently only available on PC, but an iOS port is coming in January 2025.

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com

item.title: Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection Gets Big Discount For Black Friday
item.content:encoded:
https://www.gamespot.com/articles/jurassic-park-classic-games-collection-gets-big-discount-for-black-friday/1100-6527973/?ftag=CAD-01-10abi2f

GameSpot may receive revenue from affiliate and advertising partnerships for sharing this content and from purchases through links.

Jurassic Park was a bona fide cultural phenomenon in the 1990s, so it's no surprise that it had a wide array of video game adaptations on the 8- and 16-bit consoles. For Black Friday, you can claim a sizable discount on the Jurassic Park Classic Games Collection, which compiles seven Jurassic Park games into one tidy package. The deal brings it down to $30 from the usual $40.

This collection includes four different video game adaptations of the original Jurassic Park: the NES, Game Boy, Super NES, and Genesis games, all of which were wildly different takes on the dinosaur adventure. It also includes the Super NES and Game Boy versions of Jurassic Park 2: The Chaos Continues, and Genesis game Jurassic Park: Rampage Edition. This Black Friday discount includes both the PS5 and Nintendo Switch versions.

The Jurassic World games collection is part of a larger sale on games from Limited Run, which publishes retro compilations and physical prints of popular indie games. Right now you can also claim a good price on Sea of Solitude, Sword of the Necromancer, and the Revenant Saga duology, among others.

If that has given you a ravenous taste for Jurassic Park like a raptor who just found a delicious entire cow lowered into its enclosure, you can also get half-off the Jurassic World Ultimate Collection, which includes all six Jurassic Park films--the classic Jurassic Park trilogy and the new Jurassic World trilogy--in 4K for just $50.

For even more deals on games, movies, and just about anything else you can shake a Barbasol can at, be sure to check out all of the best Black Friday deals.

Black Friday Gaming Deals at Amazon:

  • Nintendo Switch
  • PlayStation
  • Xbox
  • PC Accessories | PC Hardware

Got a news tip or want to contact us directly? Email news@gamespot.com
